definitions.text: blue color or pigment; resembling the color of the clear sky in the daytime
examples: he had eyes of bright blue

definitions.text: any organization or party whose uniforms or badges are blue
examples: the Union army was a vast blue

definitions.text: the sky as viewed during daylight
examples: he shot an arrow into the blue

definitions.text: used to whiten laundry or hair or give it a bluish tinge
the sodium salt of amobarbital that is used as a barbiturate; used as a sedative and a hypnotic
any of numerous small butterflies of the family Lycaenidae
of the color intermediate between green and violet; having a color similar to that of a clear unclouded sky; - Helen Hunt Jackson
used to signify the Union forces in the American Civil War (who wore blue uniforms)

examples: gloomy at the thought of what he had to face
took a grim view of the economy
lonely and blue in a strange city
depressed by the loss of his job
a dispirited and resigned expression on her face
he skips asterisks and gives you the gamy details

definitions.text: belonging to or characteristic of the nobility or aristocracy
examples: patrician landholders of the American South
she was anything but puritanical in her behavior
the dark days of the war
a week of rainy depressing weather
the first dismal dispiriting days of November
